alert.note: Alert for Franklin; St. Charles; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:01PM CDT until May 14 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ST. CHARLES...NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHWESTERN ST. LOUIS COUNTIES... At 601 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chesterfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Chesterfield, Wildwood, Ballwin, Wentzville, Lake St. Louis, Dardenne Prairie, Eureka, Ellisville, Weldon Spring, Cottleville, Clarkson Valley, Spirit of St. Louis Airport, Josephville, Weldon Spring Heights, Harvester, Defiance, and Matson. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park and Route 66 State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri near exit 266. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 214 and 227. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
